result.markdown:
--- title: Does `PyFixest` match `fixest`? aliases: - /compare-fixest-pyfixest.html toc: true toc-title: "On this page" toc-location: left --- This vignette compares estimation results from `fixest` with `pyfixest` via the `rpy2` package. ## Setup ::: {#18fa9e75 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd import rpy2.robjects as ro from rpy2.robjects import pandas2ri from rpy2.robjects.packages import importr import pyfixest as pf # Activate pandas2ri pandas2ri.activate() # Import R packages fixest = importr("fixest") stats = importr("stats") broom = importr("broom") # IPython magic commands for autoreloading %load_ext autoreload %autoreload 2 # Get data using pyfixest data = pf.get_data(model="Feols", N=10_000, seed=99292) ``` ::: ## Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) ### IID Inference First, we estimate a model via `pyfixest. We compute "iid" standard errors. ::: {#bca45bef .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit = pf.feols(fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov="iid") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` OMP: Info #276: omp_set_nested routine deprecated, please use omp_set_max_active_levels instead. ``` ::: ::: We estimate the same model with weights: ::: {#a1e60209 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_weights = pf.feols( fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, weights="weights", vcov="iid" ) ``` ::: Via `r-fixest` and `rpy2`, we get ::: {#e0fc0549 .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} r_fit = fixest.feols( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, vcov="iid", ) r_fit_weights = fixest.feols( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, weights=ro.Formula("~weights"), vcov="iid", ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTE: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTE: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). ``` ::: ::: R[write to console]: NOTE: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). R[write to console]: NOTE: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). Let's compare how close the covariance matrices are: ::: {#72f6513b .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_vcov = fit._vcov r_vcov = stats.vcov(r_fit) fit_vcov - r_vcov ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=5} ``` array([[-8.13151629e-19, -8.29248564e-22], [-8.29662154e-22, -1.42301535e-19]]) ``` ::: ::: And for WLS: ::: {#fa3fdd61 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_weights._vcov - stats.vcov(r_fit_weights) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ``` array([[ 1.73472348e-18, -1.90582413e-21], [-1.90582413e-21, -1.52465931e-19]]) ``` ::: ::: We conclude by comparing all estimation results via the `tidy` methods: ::: {#fa17a069 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit.tidy() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=7} ```{=html}
Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) 2.5% 97.5%
Coefficient
X1 0.112019 0.017042 6.572948 5.181855e-11 0.078612 0.145425
X2 0.732788 0.004621 158.578261 0.000000e+00 0.723730 0.741846
``` ::: ::: ::: {#2622de83 .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} pd.DataFrame(broom.tidy_fixest(r_fit)).T ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8} ```{=html}
0 1 2 3 4
0 X1 0.112019 0.017042 6.572948 0.0
1 X2 0.732788 0.004621 158.578261 0.0
``` ::: ::: ::: {#e11abe4b .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_weights.tidy() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=9} ```{=html}
Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) 2.5% 97.5%
Coefficient
X1 0.123687 0.016975 7.286200 3.432810e-13 0.090411 0.156962
X2 0.732244 0.004610 158.844322 0.000000e+00 0.723207 0.741280
``` ::: ::: ::: {#293fe091 .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} pd.DataFrame(broom.tidy_fixest(r_fit_weights)).T ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10} ```{=html}
0 1 2 3 4
0 X1 0.123687 0.016975 7.2862 0.0
1 X2 0.732244 0.00461 158.844322 0.0
``` ::: ::: ### Heteroskedastic Errors We repeat the same exercise with heteroskedastic (HC1) errors: ::: {#d1007983 .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit = pf.feols(fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov="hetero") fit_weights = pf.feols( fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov="hetero", weights="weights" ) ``` ::: ::: {#e936321e .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} r_fit = fixest.feols( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, vcov="hetero", ) r_fit_weights = fixest.feols( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, weights=ro.Formula("~weights"), vcov="hetero", ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTE: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTE: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). ``` ::: ::: As before, we compare the variance covariance matrices: ::: {#2e48abc9 .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit._vcov - stats.vcov(r_fit) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=13} ``` array([[-1.08099836e-14, -1.51721960e-15], [-1.51721966e-15, -3.55912741e-15]]) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#7dd27b4a .cell execution_count=14} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_weights._vcov - stats.vcov(r_fit_weights) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=14} ``` array([[-7.68580078e-15, 2.60362427e-15], [ 2.60362448e-15, -1.52111871e-15]]) ``` ::: ::: We conclude by comparing all estimation results via the `tidy` methods: ::: {#2c2d74ed .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit.tidy() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=15} ```{=html}
Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) 2.5% 97.5%
Coefficient
X1 0.112019 0.017105 6.548962 6.082002e-11 0.078490 0.145548
X2 0.732788 0.004579 160.036098 0.000000e+00 0.723812 0.741763
``` ::: ::: ::: {#cf5bc181 .cell execution_count=16} ``` {.python .cell-code} pd.DataFrame(broom.tidy_fixest(r_fit)).T ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} ```{=html}
0 1 2 3 4
0 X1 0.112019 0.017105 6.548962 0.0
1 X2 0.732788 0.004579 160.036098 0.0
``` ::: ::: ::: {#6762f7c7 .cell execution_count=17} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_weights.tidy() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=17} ```{=html}
Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) 2.5% 97.5%
Coefficient
X1 0.123687 0.019470 6.352618 2.210045e-10 0.085521 0.161852
X2 0.732244 0.005169 141.653304 0.000000e+00 0.722111 0.742376
``` ::: ::: ::: {#20d29a75 .cell execution_count=18} ``` {.python .cell-code} pd.DataFrame(broom.tidy_fixest(r_fit_weights)).T ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=18} ```{=html}
0 1 2 3 4
0 X1 0.123687 0.01947 6.352618 0.0
1 X2 0.732244 0.005169 141.653304 0.0
``` ::: ::: ### Cluster-Robust Errors We conclude with cluster robust errors. ::: {#22618fc8 .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit = pf.feols(fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov={"CRV1": "f1"}) fit_weights = pf.feols( fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov={"CRV1": "f1"}, weights="weights" ) r_fit = fixest.feols( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, vcov=ro.Formula("~f1"), ) r_fit_weights = fixest.feols( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, weights=ro.Formula("~weights"), vcov=ro.Formula("~f1"), ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTE: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTE: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). ``` ::: ::: ::: {#423a193a .cell execution_count=20} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit._vcov - stats.vcov(r_fit) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=20} ``` array([[ 2.86078127e-14, -4.95778718e-15], [-4.95778718e-15, -9.43706512e-16]]) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#d8f59bee .cell execution_count=21} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_weights._vcov - stats.vcov(r_fit_weights) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=21} ``` array([[ 7.00020554e-15, 1.26505590e-14], [ 1.26505590e-14, -1.11286577e-16]]) ``` ::: ::: We conclude by comparing all estimation results via the `tidy` methods: ::: {#971ff31c .cell execution_count=22} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit.tidy() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=22} ```{=html}
Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) 2.5% 97.5%
Coefficient
X1 0.112019 0.015865 7.060624 4.823750e-09 0.080152 0.143885
X2 0.732788 0.004490 163.215618 0.000000e+00 0.723770 0.741806
``` ::: ::: ::: {#925b11c4 .cell execution_count=23} ``` {.python .cell-code} pd.DataFrame(broom.tidy_fixest(r_fit)).T ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=23} ```{=html}
0 1 2 3 4
0 X1 0.112019 0.015865 7.060624 0.0
1 X2 0.732788 0.00449 163.215618 0.0
``` ::: ::: ::: {#80e12836 .cell execution_count=24} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_weights.tidy() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=24} ```{=html}
Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) 2.5% 97.5%
Coefficient
X1 0.123687 0.018368 6.733633 1.566958e-08 0.086792 0.160581
X2 0.732244 0.005266 139.062210 0.000000e+00 0.721667 0.742820
``` ::: ::: ::: {#9d982f56 .cell execution_count=25} ``` {.python .cell-code} pd.DataFrame(broom.tidy_fixest(r_fit_weights)).T ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=25} ```{=html}
0 1 2 3 4

``` ::: ::: ## Poisson Regression ::: {#8397a5f5 .cell execution_count=26} ``` {.python .cell-code} data = pf.get_data(model="Fepois") ``` ::: ::: {#1bfefd6a .cell execution_count=27} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_iid = pf.fepois(fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov="iid", iwls_tol=1e-10) fit_hetero = pf.fepois( fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov="hetero", iwls_tol=1e-10 ) fit_crv = pf.fepois( fml="Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", data=data, vcov={"CRV1": "f1"}, iwls_tol=1e-10 ) fit_r_iid = fixest.fepois( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, vcov="iid", ) fit_r_hetero = fixest.fepois( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, vcov="hetero", ) fit_r_crv = fixest.fepois( ro.Formula("Y ~ X1 + X2 | f1 + f2"), data=data, vcov=ro.Formula("~f1"), ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` /Users/afischer/Documents/pyfixest/pyfixest/estimation/model_matrix_fixest_.py:221: UserWarning: 2 singleton fixed effect(s) detected. These observations are dropped from the model. warnings.warn( /Users/afischer/Documents/pyfixest/pyfixest/estimation/model_matrix_fixest_.py:221: UserWarning: 2 singleton fixed effect(s) detected. These observations are dropped from the model. warnings.warn( /Users/afischer/Documents/pyfixest/pyfixest/estimation/model_matrix_fixest_.py:221: UserWarning: 2 singleton fixed effect(s) detected. These observations are dropped from the model. warnings.warn( WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTES: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). 1/1 fixed-effects (2 observations) removed because of only 0 outcomes or singletons. WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTES: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). 1/1 fixed-effects (2 observations) removed because of only 0 outcomes or singletons. WARNING:rpy2.rinterface_lib.callbacks:R[write to console]: NOTES: 3 observations removed because of NA values (LHS: 1, RHS: 1, Fixed-effects: 1). 1/1 fixed-effects (2 observations) removed because of only 0 outcomes or singletons. ``` ::: ::: ::: {#bed51917 .cell execution_count=28} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_iid._vcov - stats.vcov(fit_r_iid) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=28} ``` array([[ 1.28462055e-08, -6.97520098e-10], [-6.97520098e-10, 1.80739283e-09]]) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#617993b7 .cell execution_count=29} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_hetero._vcov - stats.vcov(fit_r_hetero) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=29} ``` array([[ 2.31981933e-08, -7.87424679e-10], [-7.87424679e-10, 3.27120926e-09]]) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#900b6465 .cell execution_count=30} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_crv._vcov - stats.vcov(fit_r_crv) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=30} ``` array([[ 1.63339756e-08, -1.24809110e-10], [-1.24809110e-10, 3.27895328e-09]]) ``` ::: ::: We conclude by comparing all estimation results via the `tidy` methods: ::: {#9e224e1d .cell execution_count=31} ``` {.python .cell-code} fit_iid.tidy() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=31} ```{=html}
